p: As example of this strategy, a more lipophilic complex (MA-DFO, complex 17, Fig. 8.5) was synthesized by attaching N-methylanthranilic acid to the N-terminus, leading to a higher antimalarial activity. Zinc–desferrioxamine (Zn-DFO) complex exhibited increased permeability and improved antimalarial activity when compared to free DFO. A metal substitution reaction occurs inside the erythrocyte, forming the Fe(III)-DFO complex, which is more stable than the Zn-DFO complex (Loyevsky et al. 1993; Chevion et al. 1995).
